inn1.comm: way down the leg side and India are up and running with a wide
that's better, brings Uthappa onto the front foot and he plays to mid-off
fuller and straighter, a checked drive to mid-off
another very wide one, swinging away towards the slips as well which only served to make it look even worse
that one just about stayed within the limits, Dhoni again forced to crouch to take it around his ankles
shorter, so it carried through to Dhoni at chest height, but very wide
much better, straighter, Watts plays and misses as the ball leaves him
swinging away, too wide to start with, Watts forward and offers no shot
Watts leaves that one as well ... he only had to play at two of the nine deliveries ...
full and straight, a hint of inswing. Decent start
full again but slightly wider, and that's shovelled with not much timing into the covers
lovely line, tight and straight. Good leave outside off
typical Singh double-whammy - the last one swung in, this one fizzed across. Watts was well beaten
a fraction shorter but straight and swinging in. Defended off the back foot
good finish to the cover, booming across the right-hander, who flinches outside off
measured pace, a fraction too wide of off stump, left well alone
wide again, and swinging away
outside off again, a hint of away movement
fuller length, and squirted safely down to third man. Watts doubles his tally
full length, tight to off stump, defended solidly out to cover
beaten by a good ball outside off, although it was a slightly iffy half-drive, half-defensive shot from Poonia
low full toss, and Watts misses out on a gimme. Picks up a couple with a mistimed drive
a loud appeal as Watts flings himself into a drive, but nothing doing from umpire Howell.
wide outside off again, Watts isn't tempted this time
outside off again, left alone again. Plenty movement again, but a little misdirected at present
that's a better ball, fuller length, tighter line. It's there for the drive but somehow isn't ...
left alone again. Watts is playing with a lot of caution, and the occasional expansive intent
a bouncer that's more of a fizzer. Hardly gets up and slips down the leg side too
fuller length and swinging from the hand. A very loose waft from Poonia who plays outside the line

nailed with the straight one. Well, that was the wicket that had been threatening. It's the first ball that would have hit the stumps, and was delivered from wide of the crease, landed on a good length, and Poonia was stone-dead in front of middle as he attempted to clip through the leg side
Watson's first delivery starts outside off and swings away again. A nice sighter
better from Agarkar, starts on middle and off and swings away. Defended watchfully off the back foot
good shot from Watson, nicely timed through the leg side, although the outfield is very sluggish and Ramesh Powar pulls it up inside the midwicket boundary
end of a successful over. Scotland are being made to struggle in this conditions
full length, almost yorker length. Watson digs it out dramatically
a big appeal as Watson is rapped on the front pad. Looked very tight on the replay, as Watson wasn't quite playing a shot
outside off stump. Doing too much
pushed firmly through the covers
lovely delivery, pitches on middle-and-leg and bends back in. Watson not sure how best to combat this swing
getting off strike is a good start, and Watts hustles through for a quick single as Watson squirts this one off an inside-edge
a more forceful stroke to finish, on the front foot and driven behind square. A loud cheer from the sparce but partisan crowd
drawn onto the front foot again and pushed out to cover
Singh is back in action as Watts plays flashily through the gap at gully. A little chancy, but every run counts
defended on the front foot
better line and length now from Agarkar
drawn forward again and determinedly defended

lovely shot, Watson gives himself room and smears Agarkar up and over the covers. But somehow the ball gets bogged down on the way to the boundary, and is easily overhauled. Very tough going for the batsmen
another lovely strike, but this one too can't quite reach the boundary. A full-blooded drive stops about a metre short
defended off the front foot, and Singh fields and shies in his follow-through. A bit of aggression
a massive yahoo outside off stump. A bit of width this time for Watts to cash in on. But he doesn't
fuller length, almost a low full toss, and Singh fields again in his followthrough
a big appeal and that's gone. Big nip off the wicket and the thinnest of grazes as Singh finds enough movement to confound Watts. A dogged effort, but that's both openers gone now
full and straight. Drawn onto the front foot and nudged along the ground through the gully
perfect line and length, just outside off stump and bending back. Majid comes within a whisker of being both bowled and caught-behind
defended
and at last, there's Scotland's first boundary and it was a beauty. Just a fraction too wide, but Majid was onto in a trice and square-drove it elegantly past point
another forceful stroke through the covers, but this one isn't timed
steered safely down to third man with an open face. A better over this for Scotland
full length and that's a genuine edge as Singh finds some trademark late movement. But it flies low and safely through the gap at gully
massive appeal and that looked tight. Watson had a half stride in, it pitched in line, straightened up and hit him on the kneeroll. But possibly too high
very wide of off stump but not called, strangely
and the floodgates have opened ... sort of. An excellent cut shot whistles past point. And Watson has his first boundary
lots of shouting and a bit of indecision about this one, but all safe in the end
full and driven again, but picked up in the covers. And that's the end of the over
outside off stump, Haq lets it go to Dhoni
slower ball, Haq plays a limp prod and the ball bounces twice through to the keeper
on off stump, shapes to come back into the left-hander who defends back down the pitch
hint of width this time, Haq opens the face and guides the ball down to third man
sign of aggression from Watson, takes a couple of steps down the track but Agarkar follows him and fires the ball at the pads
on off stump, Watson covers the movement and plays down to gully
down the leg side, Ian Howell extends his arms
full on off stump, Haq comes half forward and drives to mid-off
nice delivery, in the channel outside off stump and Haq is very close to getting the edge
driven firmly to extra cover, still help for the bowlers even though the pitch is slow
nips back at Haq, who defends down to Patel in his follow through
close, another top delivery, extra bounce outside off stump and Haq plays a flat-footed drive without making contact
makes contact with somewhere roughly near the middle of the bat, but goes straight to cover...a good start from Patel
on leg stump and nicely timed by Watson, but straight to the man at midwicket
again Watson tries to get down the pitch to Agarkar, but the bowler pulls his length back and the ball thuds into the thigh pad
that's the width Watson is looking for, but his expansive drive takes the toe-end of the bat and bobbles towards second slip
shot of the day, on leg stump and elegantly flicked over square leg, one bounce over the boundary...Watson showing his power and placement
nudged off the hip, wide of square leg who completes the fielding
width from Agarkar and Haq throws the bat at it, edging high and wide over the slips down to third man...useful over for Scotland, some off the middle and some not
behind the line, defended back to the bowler
on middle and leg, flicked very fine and long leg can't get around to stop it, boundaries starting to flow now for Scotland as the bowlers lose their line

hint of controversy in the middle, Watson drives on the up towards mid-off and RP Singh dives forward and claims the catch...Watson isn't happy and lingers on the outfield as the umpires come together and eventually Watson is called back as replays suggest the ball has bounced...it's been a season for calling batsmen back
flicked towards mid-on...Watson needs to calm himself
pushed into the covers, a bit of spice to this contest now
he's gone this time, his concentration clearly wasn't right and he flicks a ball off leg stump straight to square leg, Piyush Chawla comes forward and takes a fine low catch, no doubt about this one

and he breaks through straight away, bangs the ball and Haq goes for the pull. But it takes the splice and loops into the leg side, square leg skips around a few paces to take an easy catch...Scotland wobbling badly now
back of a length, blocked into the leg side
angling across McCallum, lets it go throughot Dhoni
similar ball from RP Singh, McCallum not interested in chasing it
sprays this one too wide of off stump, the extra brings up 50 for Scotland
rides the bounce nicely, plays down to third man as McCallum opens his account
takes the pad into the leg side
tries to work through the leg side, takes the pad
positive shot, over-pitched outside off stump and leans into a drive through extra cover, the slow outfield means it pulls up short and poor running means they only get two
comes forward, takes the pad and drops by the batsman's feet...they scamper a quick single
back and across, Hamilton plays with a straight bat back down the pitch
swings down the leg side, no problem for Ian Howell to call that a wide
back on target, Hamilton drops the ball into the off side
pushed backward of point, enough time for a single as Hamilton retains the strike
nearly for India, outside off stump, no footwork from Hamilton as he pushes at the ball and nearly gets an edge
played from the crease, RP Singh fields in his follow through
on off stump, turned with the angle past square-leg and with enough timing and placement for a brace
another loose forward prod from Hamilton, onto the front foot but the ball beats the edge, a fine over from RP Singh
short of a length, surprising bounce and zip from the slow surface, Hamilton is beaten and Dhoni takes it around his shoulder
beaten four times in the over, Singh's got control over Hamilton who is lucky to survive that over
on middle, comes forward with a solid block
cut him in half, nips back off the seam between bat and pad...McCallum was late on the ball, a top delivery from Patel who keeps hitting the seam
nudged into the leg side
well bowled again, extra bounce outside off stump. McCallum lunges forward, the ball takes the edge and flies wide of second slip down to third man
Patel immediately adjusts his line to the left-hander, on off stump played into the covers
another edge to third man, but this one is much more controlled and along the ground
that comes out all wrong, spears down the leg side and Dhoni can't get a clean glove on it...10th wide of the innings
another wide, down the leg side to the right hander
three in row, poor stuff from RP Singh
finally on the stumps, played towards mid-on
fortunate for that not to be called wide, too, as it goes outside off stump and McCallum doesn't make contact with a cut
takes the pad into the on side, Yuvraj Singh cleans up at square leg
outside off stump, left alone as Dhoni takes it around shin height
doesn't quite bounce as much as McCallum expected, squirted into the covers
that was nearly wide, but everyone has had enough of that long over so RP Singh gets away with it outside off stump
outside off stump, driven out to point
inside edge into the pad and bobbles behind square on the leg side for a single
another extra, oversteps this time and McCallum lets it go outside off stump...India have four wickets, but haven't been on top of their game
on off stump, comes forward and defends to mid-off
another no-ball, a firm drive to mid-off where Dravid pulls off a fine save to save a few runs
that's more like it, outside off stump and moves away off the seam to beat McCallum's push...still plenty on offer for the seamers if they hit the right spot
solid from McCallum, onto the front foot and played to point
what a beauty, leapt off a length and seamed away from the right-hander...that would have been too good for many better players than McCallum
looped onto a nice length, and watchfully defended
lots of air on that delivery, and Hamilton is down into position early for the sweep and dabs it behind square
a bit of a long-hop, but McCallum can't quite time his thump through the off side
quicker and fuller, and that hustles onto the bat. McCallum defends hastily off the back foot
down on the sweep and well nudged behind square
the end of a very tidy first over
first ball after the break is a loosener on the pads, and Hamilton tucks that off the thigh pad to fine leg
dropped but what an effort. A loose clip off the toes from McCallum, and Yuvraj at full stretch can't cling on with his left hand
passes harmlessly by this time. Time to settle back in
full stride, head right over the ball in a defensive stroke
strays down the leg side, and rightly called, despite a yelp of an appeal for a caught-behind
tucked off the toes again, along the ground this time. Munaf hasn't quite warmed up yet
better ball, lifts off a full length and takes the edge. But second slip can't intercept and third man tidies up
pushed out to midwicket
watching and waiting ... tantalising bowling
looped right up in the air, and lands on a perfect length. Teasing bowling
Hamilton is itching to cash in ...
lovely shot, a little bit too short, and clubbed past point with quick feet.
pitches outside off, tweaks back in a touch. Tidy start
looped up outside off, massive slog sweep from McCallum and Dhoni behind the stumps is deceived
drawn forward in a defensive block
good line and length, Scotland need to rotate the strike
big stride in and defended again
that's vast! Right in the slot for the shot, and McCallum opens his shoulder to bludgeon this one clean out of the ground. Top shot
full toss, and that's smeared through midwicket by Hamilton. That was almost waist-height, and no mistakes. Consecutive boundaries for Scotland
googly, well picked by Hamilton
tucked behind square and the batsmen cross. Lots of gaps now appearing thanks to those big strikes
a yelped appeal as McCallum is drawn forward
quicker, and fizzes through out of the back of the hand. Mixes it up well and McCallum is beaten outside off
forward again, and the ball loops up in the air off the front pad
big stride and dabbed into the off side. Excellent quick call and another run to the total
shorter and turning into the pads, tucked square for one more
looped onto a good length. "Oiiyy!" says Dhoni for no apparent reason
a bit of a slash outside off. Hamilton was playing for extravagent turn
From power to finesse. A very late dink through the legs of slip. Well played
driven on the up by McCallum, and that didn't quite go where intended. But it's a boundary nonetheless, through third man instead of the covers
good riposte, and respectfully defended
a fraction shorter, defended off the back foot
drawn forward again and driven into the gap. The fifty stand came up with the last shot, and now there's the 100
more air, and defended
good finish to the over. A testing time for the young legspinner
flight and bite. McCallum comes forward again and drives firmly to cover
clipped into the leg-side, and another very useful single
excellent length, looped right up to middle-and-leg, and turns to meet Hamilton's defensive stroke
right on the spot again. No liberties to be taken there
on leg stump, and pushed out to midwicket
misdirected, and this one is clipped down to the fine-leg boundary by Hamilton. That's an important boundary, and good momentum for Scotland since the rain break
uses his feet again to meet the delivery with a dead bat
shorter, and cracked behind square. Not quite timed though
lovely loop and flight, but McCallum's eyes don't light up. He simply pushes this into the gap
tucked away behind point with an angled bat. One more to the total
onto the back foot, and pushed into the covers for a quick single that became a leisurely single when the fielder didn't rush
picks the gap expertly with a firm push
slightly quicker, and pushed back hastily to the bowler
more air and a big rip from outside off stump. McCallum didn't quite reach that one
quicker and flatter, and an attempted smear into the leg side
in the air ... but safe. McCallum down on one knee to sweep, and found a steepling top-edge. Karthik at backward square couldn't make up the ground though.
firmly forward to complete the over. Scotland's progress remains serene
nudged into the leg side
onto the front foot, taken on the pad and half a shout but going down the leg side
connects with a forceful sweep out to deep backward square and Munaf Patel is a  bit slow so they make it back for three
clipped into the leg side
outside off stump, played off the front foot into the covers
handsome shot, leans into a straight drive which races down the ground but long on runs round to save the boundary
tossed up outside off stump, McCallum comes forward with bat and pad together
swept powerfully from outside off stump, taken out to deep square-leg
driven down to long off
defended into the covers, Dhoni chases to prevent a run
clubs another sweep out to deep square-leg, playing with the spin and keeping the ball along the ground
the left-hander also plays with the spin down to long off
nudged into the leg side, well-judged single
quicker ball, played off the back foot back to the bowler
swept off middle and leg, with excellent timing and placement down to fine leg...the Scottish supporters make some noise
bat and pad together

another boundary, McCallum latches onto the sweep - he likes that shot - but this four is more down to a lazy effort on the rope by Munaf Patel who barely makes any attempt to bend his back and stop that
a breakthrough, McCallum tries to make room to go through the off side but can only bottom edge through to Dhoni, who takes the catch very well and an impressive innings is ended
full toss, clipped straight to mid-on
another full toss, again Hamilton misses out...finds midwicket
driven to short extra-cover
dropped into the off side and the two batsmen complete a well-taken single despite Yuvraj being the fielder
Smith defends his first ball into the covers
comes forward, takes the pad into the covers
round the wicket, defended to the leg side
makes a big stride forward, pushed into the covers
goes for the sweep but doesn't connect, ball takes the pad
pushed into the covers
takes the outside edge down to short third-man
outside off stump, Smith cuts and misses
invention from Hamilton who brings out the reverse sweep, doesn't make great contact but collects two through third man
punches down to long on
now Smith brings out the reverse sweep, and falls over in the process, but makes good enough contact to go over point's head and away to the deep cover boundary
driven firmly back to Powar
flighted outside off stump, Smith uses his feet but thumps it straight back to the bowler
flatter and down the leg side, loose from Powar, and Dhoni can't take it as the ball races down for five wides
really tosses this one up, Smith defends to cover
driven with a full face down to long off
that's close, and given him, playing across the line to a legspinner and he's taken in front of middle and leg, straightens and was a simple decision for Ian Gould
forced off the back foot through point, off the mark
turned through midwicket with the spin
plays back, that's dangerous, and Chawla nearly forces one through but Wright gets down on it
dribbles into the leg side
comes forward with bat and pad together
angled towards backward point
goes back, tries to work through the leg side but doesn't make contact
flicked straight to square leg from outside off stump
again picks out square leg...not able to find the gaps
finally picks a hole in the field, out to deep square-leg and brings up Scotland's 150...that's a decent recovery
played with the turn into the point area
turned through square leg
tries to drive but inside-edges into his boot
dabbed through the off side, out to deep cover, keeps the strike rotating
googly from Chawla, well bowled, and Hamilton didn't pick it as be tried to go through the leg side and missed
defended down the track, ends a good spell from Chawla
worked down to long on
another reverse sweep, almost from outside leg stump, and deep cover prevents the boundary
fiddled to midwicket, Hamilton must bat out the innings
drifts down the leg side, another extra to the total
punched off the back foot down to long on
driven down to long off
turned to midwicket
beaten outside off stump, a good return
dropped That's a monstrous yahoo, just a heave through the line, and deep cover can't cling on
more composure in this shot, which is played off the back foot into the covers
a firm drive from Hamilton - a much better shot - but cover picks it up
short and speared into the pads, and clipped square
fuller length, and pushed into the covers to a loud "no!"
full and straight, patted out to point
a hint of swing away from the left-hander. Hamilton made room to have a thrash, but made too much room ...
much fuller length outside off, almost a yorker. Hamilton had grand ambitions but had to dig it out in the end
half-volley outside off, timed well but picked up athletically at point
very firm strike and half-stopped at full stretch in the covers. Wright made room and really thumped that
Wright was coasting there and nearly pays the price as Chawla hits the stumps from mid-on. The third umpire is called into action, but he's home by a foot
slower ball from Agarkar and that swings right into the middle of Wright's bat. A sprawling dive from Karthik at deep cover, but that was travelling
pushed into the covers. More measured strike
yorker-length on the toes, Hamilton tipped and ran, but would have been out had the shy from cover found its target
Wright throws the bat at that, and a thick edge flies down to third man. Fair play to him, you've got to chance it at this stage
makes room again, and pushes off the back foot to cover

there's the breakthrough! It was full and straight, Hamilton attempted a paddle sweep but instead is bowled round his legs. Not much celebration from Agarkar, but a warm ovation for Hamilton. He's given his side a chance
full and a hint of inswing, but Munaf isn't bending his back just yet. Pushed calmly into the covers
yorker, jabbed down into the crease, and the batsmen scurry through for a single
full again, and clipped off the pads to midwicket. A moment's hesitation and the chance of a second is lost
shorter and wider, by way of variation
full again, and chipped back over the head of the bowler. Munaf is tall but not that tall
elegantly steered into the covers off the back foot. Another good over for the Scots, who are set to post a 200-plus target
picks the gap again
brilliant strike! Quick footwork, big swing and that's middled, straight over the sightscreen! That ball is off down the road, and here's a replacement
more attacking intent from Wright
cut past point
full and pushed out to midwicket. The runs are flowing nicely
aimed at the blockhole again, but two more through midwicket. Fourteen runs off Agarkar's last over. Just six balls remain now
dabbed down to fine leg. Wright was always looking for two there, but the throw from Agarkar was accurate and Dhoni gathered cleanly to whip the bails off.
full and straight, and driven back to the bowler
smeared down to third man where Agarkar fields on the bounce
a big smear from Blain and Chawla gathers well with a tumble at mid-on
a buccaneering strike from Hoffmann, through the covers
more of the same, and that's the end of a very impressive recovery from the Scots.

inn2.comm: way down the leg side, India off and runnings with a wide
that's better, brings him into the front foot
outside off stump, hint of movement and lets it go
pushed into the covers, backward point can't prevent the single
over-pitched outside off stump, driven firmly at cover who parries the ball but prevents any runs
picks out mid-off, who is a little slow off the mark and Gambhir is quick to spot the chance for a single
and again, this time he is at mid-on for the right-hander and can't prevent another single
heading down the leg side and picked off nicely to fine-leg for the first boundary
outside off stump, played out towards backward point...they need to make the most of the new ball in helpful conditions
back of a length, defended from the crease
again going down the leg side, but it's clipped squarer this time and long leg is able to keep them to a single
outside off stump, left alone as he swings back in towards the left hander
drops the ball into the covers with soft hands and another quick single as cover can't get in fast enough
comes forward, taken on the pad and the ball loops behind towards the wicketkeeper
stretches forward and defends to cover, good line and length from Hoffmann
well bowled, jagged off the seam away from the left hander who fences at it and nearly gets an edge
on leg stump and turned down to long leg
outside off stump and left alone
beauty, moves away from Uthappa off the seam and decent carry through to Smith
cut off the back foot straight to backward point
top delivery, more movement off the seam and Gambhir is left prodding as the ball just misses the edge
played back to the bowler
stays on target and defended into the covers
Gambhir not finding it easy early on, gets behind this and plays to cover
shoulders arms outside off stump, a testing over from Blain
gets a decent stride in, is taken on the pad but outside the line of off stump
nips back off the seam, hits high on the pad and down towards the slips
that was fairly straight, worked off the stumps into midwicket but if he'd missed it the bowler would have been in with a good shout
outside off stump, left alone as the batsmen continue to play watchfully
defended on the move, cover and the bowler converge on the ball
bit of confusion, dropped into the off side and Uthappa wanted a single, but it wasn't on and a direct hit from cover would have been very tight...that's what pressure creates
outside off stump, ball carries through very low to Colin Smith...actually it bounces twice
nice drive, but straight to cover on the bounce and they can't find the gaps
another one barely gets above ankle height and this is very tricky for India...good early bowling
played into the covers, Fraser Watts quickly onto it
cut away with power, but backward point gets a hand on it and deflects the ball towards to third man
on off stump, defended back to Blain
tucked off his hip to square leg
tries to push for a quick single into the covers but it isn't on
punched square on the off side to point...something will have to give shortly
well bowled, again nips back and takes Uthappa towards the top of the leg
nothing there for the batsman, Watts is like a whippet in the covers
straighter and turned to short midwicket, good over

there's some aggression, Gambhir carves this through the covers...but Uthappa incredibly close to being run-out as Watts' throw comes into the keeper, but Smith takes too long to get the ball back to the stumps and Uthappa is safe
inside edge into the pads and half an appeal from Blain, but it's more exclamation
driven through mid-off, who gets a hand on it to take the pace off the ball, pulls up short of the boundary
played towards mid-on, Gambhir saunters down the pitch before realising the run isn't and heads back to his ground...all rather lazy that from India
taken off the pads to short midwicket, it shows that these two haven't batted much together, the understanding isn't there
outside off stump, left alone, again carries through very low
angled down to third man and there is more yelling and screaming between the batsmen before they finally agree on two
onto the front foot, defended into the off side
top shot, big stride towards the ball and lofts it straight back over the bowlers' head
dropped into the off side, can't get a single
played at the top of the bounce, driven to backward point
caught on the crease slightly and takes an outside edge down to third man
outswing to the right hander, takes the edge between slip and gully down to third man
edge falls short of second slip, not great footwork on that occasion
handsome shot, launches a drive towards a wide half volley and bisects cover and mid-off, despite a slow outfield the ball still makes it
on middle, plays with the movement and clips it away through midwicket for another boundary as the runs begin to flow
touch short, helped round the corner but without any timing
taken high on the pad, appeal from Blain but that wasn't close
clipped into the leg side, straight to midwicket
again tucked to the man at midwicket, who prevents any runs
takes the pad, drops into the leg side and they scamper a single
worked from off stump to square leg
agricultural from Uthappa, but effective, as he comes down the track and takes this through midwicket with something of a heave, but there's enough on the ball
defended to point, India ticking over now
punched to point
outside off stump, a touch to wide for the umpore
has a flash at this one, nearly getting the edge...Scotland need to keep plugging away
outside edge, no footwork, down to third man
on middle, defended to mid-on
well driven, over-pitched from Nel and sent rocketing past mid-off to bring up India's 50 as rain starts to fall again
dropped by the feet, a quick single and Nel's football skills aren't up to it as he tries to kick the ball onto the stumps in his follow through
clipped off the pads but can't find the gap
that one finds the gap alright ... it was there to be clobbered, and Gambhir flicks that effortlessly up and over the man at square leg. One bounce and over the rope
nudged away to rotate the strike
short and angled into the right-hander. A great diving stop at slip
stand and deliver. Pitched up in the slot, and belted back over the bowler's head
massive appeal, and that looked close, but Uthappa was outside the line
wicket-to-wicket delivery, turned gently into the leg-side
drawn onto the front foot and firmly driven, but no way through the ring on the off side
back of a length, and tucked off the ribs to short midwicket
fuller length this time, but the line remains good. Turned to the leg side again
"That's a stonking shot," declares Martin, and he's right. All timing, and a perfectly straight bat
a dot ball to finish, and India are cruising at the moment
Smith behind the stumps did well to rescue that
pushed into the covers
tucked off the pads, and finds the gap at square leg
shorter and wider of the stumps - an attempted cut but can't time it
lovely ball, nips off the seam and Gambhir is genuinely beaten outside off. Nice take too from Smith
almost a carbon copy. Lovely bowling again
driven through the gap, no great venom but decent timing
full length and swings onto the middle of the bat as Gambhir pushes through midwicket. Hamilton can't intercept
dragged forward and beaten. Good riposte
short and straight. Gambhir jabs down into the crease with a hop and they scurry through
in the slot and clobbered. High and handsome, and bounces just inside the rope at long-off
a fraction quicker and nips away. Defended with an angled bat to gully
right up in the blockhole - good delivery - and dug out
swinging delivery on a driveable length, but it's driven straight to short cover
better length, defended into the ground and away to slip
on leg stump and turned away
shorter and dabbed away through the gully, but a fine diving stop
good finish to the over and that completes a maiden. Well bowled
width ... too much width. Uthappa attempts a dab, but can't reach
short in length but a tight line. Turned to midwicket
that's huge. Uthappa dances down the track and has an almighty swipe... high, high and very handsome over deep midwicket
good response. Faster and finds some extra bounce as Uthappa swishes again
Uthappa's on the rampage now. Had similar intentions for this shot, but under-edges it to mid-on
well bowled Nel. Kept his composure with the pressure on, and Uthappa reverts to a respectable back-foot defensive to finish the over
lovely bowling again, probing that off-stump corridor and Smith gathers neatly with a quiet "oh yeah"
right on the spot again
McCallum fields well at backward-point, as Gambhir tries to force through the off side. They scamper a single though
"Top draw, that," drawls Smith as Uthappa digs out an attempted yorker
perfect off-stump line, no width to work with at all
dropped, although that was a very tough chance. Uthappa checked his defensive drive, and Wright couldn't quite swoop in his followthrough. End of a good over though
banged in at a good pace, steered down to third man
finds the gap
slightly off line and that fizzes down to fine leg. The outfield seems much quicker now the Indians are peppering the boundary
a very high bouncer indeed
still pushing the batsman onto the back foot, but that's fifty for Uthappa with another dab to third man
a bit of frustration in Nel's bowling. That was short and wild down the leg-side
banged in again. He's getting a little carried away with the bounce now. Same result
there's the hundred for India, and it's brought up with a push down the ground
clipped off the pads. Scotland are chasing the game now and losing their discipline
having said that, there's the breakthrough! And it's a beautiful ball from Wright, a genuine inswinger that pitched on off and skidded through the gate. Well deserved, and timely too
"Oh my word!" declares Smith behind the stumps as Karthik pads up and comes perilously close to losing his off stump. Perfect judgment, you could call it
bat to ball this time, and defended
a hint of inswing again, and pushed back up the pitch
superb finish, pitching off and straightening. Defended uneasily to complet a successful over
steady start, looped onto a good length
Gambhir comes down the wicket to defend
faster and flatter and speared into the pads. Turned to leg
a fraction too short, and that's punished through the covers. No margin for error at all
much better length, a Powar-esque length that bites a bit too
teasing again. Karthik plays it off the pitch and adjusts hastily to the lack of turn
nudged down to third man
too much width outside off stump, and steered down to third man again. The right-hander's third man this time though
better line and length. No room for manoeuvring
pitches middle-and-off and tails away. Defended out to cover
good rhythm now, on off stump or thereabouts, and being treated accordingly
Gambhir hops back to defend and that's the end of the over.
a heave into the leg side, picks out square leg
dabbed into the covers to rotate the strike
dropped into the infield, another quick single
cuts powerful through the infield as Haq again gives the batsman too much width
nicely bowled, nearly beat him in the flight but they get a single into the covers
chopped away through backward point, well played and keeps the scoreboard ticking over
on off stump, defended straight down the pitch
again a good line and length, pushed into the covers but can't find the gap
misses out this time as he cuts straight to backward point
punched off the back foot to cover, a fumble but it doesn't cost anything
dropped short and that's easy pickings on such a slow pitch against a medium-pacer, Gambhir was quickly onto it and pulled the ball over midwicket
and that nudge into the leg side brings him his half-century off 76 balls
down the track and driven through extra cover, long off runs round and actually keeps the batsmen to one, although it should have been an easy two
chopped down to short third-man, giving himself a hint of room
defended into the leg side
too short and it sits up to say "hit me", which Karthik does out to deep cover
good footwork, but an equally good stop at extra cover as a rocket-like drive is parried one-handed to prevent any runs
finds the gap with another drive, down to long off
tries to glide this ball down to third man, early gave an edge to slip but it fell short
goes big over the leg side, opens his shoulders but the outfield means the ball doesn't run all the way...and the running isn't that flash, so it's just the two
tucked gently off the hip down to long leg
well bowled, extra bounce from Wright and some seam movement takes it past Karthik's edge...more polite banter from Colin Smith "we deserve a couple here"
guided down to third man
quick single into the leg side, the throw didn't hit but it was fairly comfortable in any case
chips down the track and clips to midwicket
very full, dug out to extra cover
arm ball, comes into Gambhir who guides it out to deep cover
edged towards third man, can't beat the fielder
driven to mid-off, who is inside the circle but can't stop the single
goes in the air through cover, there are cries of 'catch it' but Watson loses his footing although it probably wouldn't have made a difference
the drive brings an inside edge, between the legs into the on side
keeps the batsman in defence, played to mid-off
very similar, mid-off again does the work
good stuff from Wright, on the stumps and Karthik can't get it away
still can't find a gap in the tight cover field
excellent over from Wright, tucks Karthik up with the final ball
drives elegantly into the covers as Haq tosses the ball up, a fumble at cover brings a single
swept off the stumps to short fine-leg
a there's the breakthrough, Haq has deserved that...Karthik flicks the ball in the air towards midwicket where McCallum takes a sharp catch, a nice moment for Scotland to enjoy
round the wicket with a slip to Yuvraj, defended to point
comes forward, defended under his eyes
padded away outside off stump, Haq's appeal more out of hope than expectation
driven back to Wright in his follow through
cut away, but more good work from McCallum, this time at backward point, keeps them to a single
bit of bounce to surprise Yuvraj, who takes a painful blow on the inside thigh - on a cold day, too - that will hurt and he drops the bat as he rubs it
composes himself and defends to cover
whipped off the stumps, well placed wide of long leg and Yuvraj is quick enough for two...the runnings should speed up with Yuvraj in
flicked in the air, through square leg, and he jogs back for another two
leans back, driven through the covers
flowing drive through the covers, class shot, he extends his arm through the ball and it races over the slow outfield
turned off the stumps through midwicket, superb timing and it almost reaches the boundary before a good piece of work from Poonia in the deep, as he flicks it back with inches to spare
tossed very high, whipped to midwicket
goes for the cut, gets a bottom edge through Smith's legs but very harsh to call that a chance...he didn't have a real chance of catching that
middles this one, but cover gets a finger tip on it and long off collects
another handsome drive from Yuvraj, bobbles in front of cover who can't stop it cleanly
fires this past the right hand of cover, with the timing and placement to reach the boundary...very easy from Gambhir
tucked to square leg...countdown time for India, 49 needed
punched to extra cover
great wrists, outstanding shot, taken from outside off stump through midwicket and it races away...Yuvraj knew that was going for four
that's massive, goes over the top and clears the boundary with an easy swing over the arms over long on and the ball lands on top of one of tents
defended into the covers
angled away past backward point, down to third man
played from the crease, down to mid-on
taken off the stumps, more good wrist work, down to long leg and back for two more
lucky for Yuvraj, goes for a cut and gets a big bottom edge past the stumps and the keeper, away to the boundary
turned off the pads out to deep square-leg
pushed to mid-on
bit of extra bounce, defended into the covers
angled away to third man
elegant drive through the covers, wide half volley and Gambhir put it way with power
straight ball, worked into the midwicket area
goes for an expansive drive, but comes of a thick inside half of the bat towards mid-on
good ball, came back off the seam into Gambhir who poked at it...beaten by a lack of bounce too as it doesn't carry to Smith
driven on the bounce to backward point
nearly drags into his stumps, an inside edge bounces over the timber...no luck for Scotland
defended square on the off side
well bowled, tight to Gambhir's body and defended back to the bowler
flash outside off stump, no contact and no reward for a decent over from Blain...a maiden, well bowled
down the leg side, a rare fumble from Smith and the ball bounces away for third man to field
nicely bowled, outside off stump and Gambhir again pushes forward without making contact
drive and a miss from Gambhir, would be nice for Hoffmann to finish with a wicket
driven to backward point, Scotland aren't gifting the win to India
dismissive from Gambhir, fed up of patting the ball back he frees his arms and goes high and handsome over long off for six
angled down to third man
driven on the up straight at extra cover
picked off down to long leg
cover dives over Yuvraj's back-foot drive and there's enough timing for another boundary
doesn't bounce much, Yuvraj goes for another drive but doesn't make contact
well bowled, takes leg stump with a well-directed yorker as Yuvraj moves across his stumps...reward for Blain's last couple of overs and a late strike for Scotland
and receives a bouncer first up from Blain, takes Dravid a little by surprise and he was to sway out of the way...welcome back Rahul
driven to mid-on
driven on the bounce to cover, the crowd think it's a catch
powerful straight drive, nearly took off Nel's kneecaps and he does well to jump away from it...self preservation over heroics on that occasion
tucked away to the onside.
picked off through the leg side by Dravid, classical, one shot away now
clipped out to square leg
played to square leg, can't get the single so Dravid has a chance to finish the match
playing away from his body, just wide of backward point who makes a valiant dive as the ball goes to third man
on middle and played back to Blain
dropped into the covers "get them in singles"
played down into the gully, Haq prevents the winning run
whipped down to fine leg and there's the win, a very comfortable seven wicket margin in the end
